toolbar.title: Toolbar
toolbar.doubleClickPoleOrZeroToRemove: Double-click a pole or zero to remove it.
toolbar.poleZeroLimitExceeded: Operation cancelled: the total pole/zero count would exceed the limit (256).

firstorderiir.name: First-Order IIR Filter
firstorderiir.description: IIR filter realized by a first-order transfer function. Composed of one real pole and one real zero.

biquad.name: Biquad Filter
biquad.description: Widely used IIR filter in audio signal processing. Realized by second-order transfer function, and can be cascaded to form higher-order filters with sharper characteristics. Implementation based on Audio EQ Cookbook by Robert Bristow-Johnson.

delay.name: Delay Filter
delay.description: Pure delay filter with the specified number of poles at the origin. H(z)=z^(-n).

comb.name: Comb Filter / Delay
comb.description: Filter with periodic frequency response. Widely used in software synthesizers and the like due to its ease of implementation.

movingAverage.name: Moving Average Filter
movingAverage.description: The simplest lowpass FIR filter that outputs the average of the past N samples. Used for noise reduction and smoothing.

butterworth.name: Butterworth Filter
butterworth.description: IIR filter with maximally flat magnitude response in the passband. Features monotonic attenuation.

sinc.name: Sinc Filter (approximation)
sinc.description: FIR filter based on the impulse response of an ideal low-pass filter (sinc function). Theoretically achieves ideal rectangular frequency response, but truncation error occurs due to finite length.

gaussian.name: Gaussian Filter (approximation)
gaussian.description: FIR filter with Gaussian function impulse response. Features smooth frequency response and rapid decay in the time domain.

aboutThisTool.title: About this tool
aboutThisTool.description: This tool visualizes the transfer function and response when you change the poles and zeros of a digital filter. Drag poles and zeros on the complex plane, or select a preset from the "Filter Design" section.

references.title: References
references.audioEqCookbook: Standard reference for biquad filter design equations. Provides coefficient calculation formulas for various filter types (LPF, HPF, BPF, Notch, etc.) using the Bilinear Transform.
references.controlSystemsAcademy: Educational site for learning Bode plot changes through interactive pole-zero placement. Visualizes the relationship between pole-zero movement on the complex plane and transfer functions.
references.falstadFilter: Digital filter simulator by Paul Falstad. Real-time visualization of pole-zero placement, frequency response, impulse response, and more.
